docsTags.text: icon - The container that wraps the alert icon.

props.name: closable
props.docs: Set to true to make the alert closable.

props.name: open
props.docs: Indicates whether or not the alert is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

props.name: type
props.docs: The type of alert.

events.docs: Emitted after the alert closes and all transitions are complete.
Emitted after the alert opens and all transitions are complete.
Emitted when the alert closes. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being closed.
Emitted when the alert opens. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being opened.

docsTags.text: - The element to animate. If multiple elements are to be animated, wrap them in a single container.
docsTags.name: slot

props.name: delay
props.docs: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

props.name: direction
props.docs: Determines the direction of playback as well as the behavior when reaching the end of an iteration.

props.name: duration
props.docs: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete.

props.name: easing
props.docs: The rate of the animation's change over time.

props.name: endDelay
props.docs: The number of milliseconds to delay after the active period of an animation sequence.

props.name: fill
props.docs: Sets how the animation applies styles to its target before and after its execution.

props.name: iterationStart
props.docs: The offset at which to start the animation, usually between 0 (start) and 1 (end).

props.name: iterations
props.docs: The number of iterations to run before the animation completes. Defaults to `Infinity`, which loops.

props.name: keyframes
props.docs: The keyframes to use for the animation. If this is set, `name` will be ignored.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the animation to use.

props.name: pause
props.docs: Pauses the animation. The animation will resume when this prop is removed.

props.name: playbackRate
props.docs:
Sets the animation's playback rate. The default is `1`, which plays the animation at a normal speed. Setting this
to `2`, for example, will double the animation's speed. A negative value can be used to reverse the animation. This
value can be changed without causing the animation to restart.

methods.name: cancel
methods.docs: Clears all KeyframeEffects caused by this animation and aborts its playback.

methods.name: finish
methods.docs: Sets the playback time to the end of the animation corresponding to the current playback direction.

methods.name: getAnimationNames
methods.docs: Gets a list of all supported animation names.

methods.name: getCurrentTime
methods.docs: Gets the current time of the animation in milliseconds.

methods.name: getEasingNames
methods.docs: Gets a list of all supported easing function names.

methods.name: setCurrentTime
methods.docs: Sets the current time of the animation in milliseconds.

events.docs: Emitted when the animation is canceled.
Emitted when the animation finishes.
Emitted when the animation starts or restarts.

slots.docs: The element to animate. If multiple elements are to be animated, wrap them in a single container.

props.name: download
props.docs: Tells the browser to download the linked file as this filename. Only used when `href` is set.

props.name: href
props.docs: When set, the underlying button will be rendered as an `<a>` with this `href` instead of a `<button>`.

props.name: loading
props.docs: Set to true to draw the button in a loading state.

props.name: name
props.docs: An optional name for the button. Ignored when `href` is set.

props.docs: Set to true to draw a pill-style button with rounded edges.

props.name: submit
props.docs: Indicates if activating the button should submit the form. Ignored when `href` is set.

props.name: target
props.docs: Tells the browser where to open the link. Only used when `href` is set.

props.name: type
props.docs: The button's type.

props.name: value
props.docs: An optional value for the button. Ignored when `href` is set.

docsTags.text: trigger - The color picker's dropdown trigger.
docsTags.name: part

docsTags.text: swatches - The container that holds swatches.
docsTags.name: part

docsTags.text: slider-handle - Hue and opacity slider handles.
docsTags.name: part

props.name: disabled
props.docs: Set to true to disable the color picker.

props.name: format
props.docs:
The format to use for the display value. If opacity is enabled, these will translate to HEXA, RGBA, and HSLA
respectively. The color picker will always accept user input in any format (including CSS color names) and convert
it to the desired format.

props.name: hoist
props.docs:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

props.name: inline
props.docs: Set to true to render the color picker inline rather than inside a dropdown.

props.name: opacity
props.docs: Whether to show the opacity slider.

props.name: size
props.docs: When `inline` is true, this determines the size of the color picker's trigger.

props.name: swatches
props.docs:
An array of predefined color swatches to display. Can include any format the color picker can parse, including
HEX(A), RGB(A), HSL(A), and CSS color names.

props.name: uppercase
props.docs: By default, the value will be set in lowercase. Set this to true to set it in uppercase instead.

props.name: value
props.docs: The current color.

events.docs: Emitted after the color picker closes and all transitions are complete.
Emitted after the color picker opens and all transitions are complete.
Emitted when the color picker's value changes.
Emitted when the color picker closes. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being closed.
Emitted when the color picker opens. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being opened.

styles.name: --grid-handle-size
styles.docs: The size of the color grid's handle.

styles.name: --grid-height
styles.docs: The height of the color grid.

styles.name: --grid-width
styles.docs: The width of the color grid.

styles.name: --slider-handle-size
styles.docs: The diameter of the slider's handle.

styles.name: --slider-height
styles.docs: The height of the hue and alpha sliders.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: Set to true to prevent the user from toggling the details.

props.name: open
props.docs: Indicates whether or not the details is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

props.name: summary
props.docs: The summary to show in the details header. If you need to display HTML, use the `summary` slot instead.

events.docs: Emitted after the details closes and all transitions are complete.
Emitted after the details opens and all transitions are complete.
Emitted when the details closes. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being closed.
Emitted when the details opens. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being opened.

styles.name: --hide-duration
styles.docs: The length of the hide transition.

styles.name: --hide-timing-function
styles.docs: The timing function (easing) to use for the hide transition.

styles.name: --show-duration
styles.docs: The length of the show transition.

styles.name: --show-timing-function
styles.docs: The timing function (easing) to use for the show transition.

slots.docs: The details' content.

slots.name: summary
slots.docs: The details' summary. Alternatively, you can use the summary prop.

docsTags.text: footer - The dialog's footer, usually one or more buttons representing various options.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: panel - The dialog panel (where the dialog and its is rendered).
docsTags.name: part

props.name: label
props.docs:
The dialog's label as displayed in the header. You should always include a relevant label even when using
`no-header`, as it is required for proper accessibility.

props.name: noHeader
props.docs:
Set to true to disable the header. This will also remove the default close button, so please ensure you provide an
easy, accessible way for users to dismiss the dialog.

props.name: open
props.docs: Indicates whether or not the dialog is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

events.docs: Emitted after the dialog closes and all transitions are complete.
Emitted after the dialog opens and all transitions are complete.
Emitted when the dialog closes. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being closed.
Emitted when the overlay is clicked. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the dialog from closing.
Emitted when the dialog opens. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being opened.

styles.name: --width
styles.docs: The preferred width of the dialog. Note that the dialog will shrink to accommodate smaller screens.

slots.docs: The dialog's content.

slots.name: footer
slots.docs: The dialog's footer, usually one or more buttons representing various options.

parts.name: panel
parts.docs: The dialog panel (where the dialog and its is rendered).

docsTags.text: footer - The drawer's footer, usually one or more buttons representing various options.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: panel - The drawer panel (where the drawer and its is rendered).
docsTags.name: part

props.name: contained
props.docs:
By default, the drawer slides out of its containing block (usually the viewport). To make the drawer slide out of
its parent element, set this prop and add `position: relative` to the parent.

props.name: label
props.docs:
The drawer's label as displayed in the header. You should always include a relevant label even when using
`no-header`, as it is required for proper accessibility.

props.name: noHeader
props.docs:
Removes the header. This will also remove the default close button, so please ensure you provide an easy,
accessible way for users to dismiss the drawer.

props.name: open
props.docs: Indicates whether or not the drawer is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

props.name: placement
props.docs: The direction from which the drawer will open.

events.docs: Emitted after the drawer closes and all transitions are complete.
Emitted after the drawer opens and all transitions are complete.
Emitted when the drawer closes. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being closed.
Emitted when the overlay is clicked. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the drawer from closing.
Emitted when the drawer opens. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being opened.

styles.name: --size
styles.docs: The preferred size of the drawer. This will be applied to the drawer's width or height depending on its `placement`. Note that the drawer will shrink to accommodate smaller screens.

slots.docs: The drawer's content.

slots.name: footer
slots.docs: The drawer's footer, usually one or more buttons representing various options.

parts.name: panel
parts.docs: The drawer panel (where the drawer and its is rendered).

props.name: containingElement
props.docs: The dropdown will close when the user interacts outside of this element (e.g. clicking).

props.name: distance
props.docs: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel away from its trigger.

props.name: hoist
props.docs:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

props.name: open
props.docs: Indicates whether or not the dropdown is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

props.name: placement
props.docs:
The preferred placement of the dropdown panel. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the panel
inside of the viewport.

props.name: skidding
props.docs: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel along its trigger.

events.docs: Emitted after the dropdown closes and all transitions are complete.

Emitted when the dropdown opens. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being opened.

methods.name: typeToSelect
methods.docs:
Initiates type-to-select logic, which automatically selects an option based on what the user is currently typing.
The key passed will be appended to the internal query and the selection will be updated. After a brief period, the
internal query is cleared automatically. This method is intended to be used with the keydown event. Useful for
enabling type-to-select when the menu doesn't have focus.

events.docs: Emitted when the menu loses focus.

docsTags.text: tags - The container in which multiselect options are rendered.
docsTags.name: part

props.name: clearable
props.docs: Set to true to add a clear button when the select is populated.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: Set to true to disable the select control.

props.name: hoist
props.docs:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

props.name: invalid
props.docs: Set to true to indicate that the user input is invalid.

props.name: label
props.docs: The select's label.

props.name: maxTagsVisible
props.docs:
The maximum number of tags to show when `multiple` is true. After the maximum, "+n" will be shown to indicate the
number of additional items that are selected. Set to -1 to remove the limit.

props.name: multiple
props.docs: Set to true to enable multiselect.

props.name: name
props.docs: The select's name.

props.name: pill
props.docs: Set to true to draw a pill-style select with rounded edges.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: The select's placeholder text.

props.name: required
props.docs: The select's required attribute.

props.name: size
props.docs: The select's size.

props.name: valid
props.docs: Set to true to indicate that the user input is valid.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the control. This will be a string or an array depending on `multiple`.

events.docs: Emitted when the control loses focus
Emitted when the control's value changes.
Emitted when the control gains focus

slots.docs: The select's options in the form of menu items.

slots.name: help-text
slots.docs: Help text that describes how to use the select.

parts.name: form-control
parts.docs: The form control that wraps the label and the input.

parts.name: tags
parts.docs: The container in which multiselect options are rendered.

docsTags.text: indicator - The skeleton's indicator which is responsible for its color and animation.

props.name: effect
props.docs: Determines which effect the skeleton will use.

styles.name: --border-radius

styles.name: --color
styles.docs: The color of the skeleton.

styles.name: --sheen-color
styles.docs: The sheen color when the skeleton is in its loading state.

parts.name: indicator
parts.docs: The skeleton's indicator which is responsible for its color and animation.

styles.name: --indicator-color
styles.docs: The color of the spinner's indicator.

styles.name: --stroke-width
styles.docs: The width of the indicator.

styles.name: --track-color
styles.docs: The color of the spinner's track.

props.name: checked
props.docs: Set to true to draw the switch in a checked state.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: Set to true to disable the switch.

props.name: name
props.docs: The switch's name attribute.

props.name: value
props.docs: The switch's value attribute.

events.docs: Emitted when the control loses focus.
Emitted when the control's checked state changes.
Emitted when the control gains focus.

styles.name: --height
styles.docs: The height of the switch.

styles.name: --thumb-size
styles.docs: The size of the thumb.

styles.name: --width
styles.docs: The width of the switch.

slots.docs: The switch's label.

props.name: active
props.docs: Set to true to draw the tab in an active state.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: Set to true to draw the tab in a disabled state.

props.name: panel
props.docs: The name of the tab panel the tab will control. The panel must be located in the same tab group.

styles.name: --focus-ring
styles.docs: The focus ring's box shadow.

slots.docs: The tab's label.

methods.name: select
methods.docs: Selects all the text in the input.

methods.name: setRangeText
methods.signature: setRangeText(replacement: string, start: number, end: number, selectMode?: 'select' | 'start' | 'end' | 'preserve') => Promise<void>
methods.docs: Replaces a range of text with a new string.

methods.name: setSelectionRange
methods.signature: setSelectionRange(selectionStart: number, selectionEnd: number, selectionDirection?: 'forward' | 'backward' | 'none') => Promise<void>
methods.docs: Sets the start and end positions of the text selection (0-based).

events.docs: Emitted when the control loses focus.
Emitted when the control's value changes.

Emitted when the control receives input.

docsTags.text: - The tooltip's target element. Only the first element will be used as the target.
docsTags.name: slot

props.name: content
props.docs: The tooltip's content.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: Set to true to disable the tooltip so it won't show when triggered.

props.name: distance
props.docs: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip away from its target.

props.name: open
props.docs: Indicates whether or not the tooltip is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

props.name: placement
props.docs:
The preferred placement of the tooltip. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the tooltip
inside of the viewport.

props.name: skidding
props.docs: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip along its target.

props.name: trigger
props.docs:
Controls how the tooltip is activated. Possible options include `click`, `hover`, `focus`, and `manual`. Multiple
options can be passed by separating them with a space. When manual is used, the tooltip must be activated
programmatically.

events.docs: Emitted after the tooltip has hidden and all transitions are complete.
Emitted after the tooltip has shown and all transitions are complete.
Emitted when the tooltip begins to hide. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being hidden.
Emitted when the tooltip begins to show. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent it from being shown.

styles.name: --hide-delay
styles.docs: The amount of time to wait before hiding the tooltip.

styles.name: --hide-duration
styles.docs: The amount of time the hide transition takes to complete.

styles.name: --hide-timing-function
styles.docs: The timing function (easing) to use for the hide transition.

styles.name: --max-width
styles.docs: The maximum width of the tooltip.

styles.name: --show-delay
styles.docs: The amount of time to wait before showing the tooltip.

styles.name: --show-duration
styles.docs: The amount of time the show transition takes to complete.

styles.name: --show-timing-function
styles.docs: The timing function (easing) to use for the show transition.

slots.docs: The tooltip's target element. Only the first element will be used as the target.
